p: Favipiravir is a new type of RNA-dependent RNA polymerase inhibitor. Additionally, it is capable of blocking the replication of other RNA viruses [ 99]. Favipiravir is converted into an active phosphoribosylated form (favipiravir-RTP) in cells and is recognized as a substrate by viral RNA polymerase, therefore inhibiting RNA polymerase activity [ 100]. Favipiravir may have potential antiviral action on SARS-CoV-2, which is a RNA virus. In a clinical trial on favipiravir for the treatment of COVID-19, the preliminary results indicated that favipiravir had more potent antiviral action than lopinavir/ritonavir [ 101].
